page.title: 01LANDSCAPE
page.content: The area which we are studying is predominantly rural with a small town in its centre. Around{Knighton}itself there are a number of farms of small acreages.The town lies in the{Teme {Valley} and the ground rises steeply on both sides to {Panpuntan Hill}and { {Kinsley Wood }on one side and{Garth {Hill}and the{Golf Course}on the other. The{River Teme}runs through the valley and because of its meander has left a few{ox-bow pools}between its source and the town of Knighton.The building of small factories has taken place on the level bank of the river which does not flood and no further building can take place on the remainder because it is liable to flooding.
